items.title: First Hong Kong, now Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- WeLab Bank, based in Hong Kong, is expanding into Southeast Asia after achieving profitability, albeit later than some competitors.
- It has launched Bank Saqu in Indonesia and is seeking a license to operate in Thailand.
- WeLab Bank is partnering with major firms like Astra in Indonesia to replicate its success in the region.

items.title: These are the most active investors in India’s startups
items.summary:
- The article identifies the most active investors in India’s startups over the past 12 months.
- It features investors who have invested in three or more companies in India during this timeframe.
- The data is subject to updates and corrections, and readers are encouraged to report inaccuracies.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet appoints Eric Trump as advisor
items.summary:
- Metaplanet, Japan's large corporate bitcoin holder, has appointed Eric Trump to its Strategic Board of Advisors.
- The company currently holds 3,200 BTC and aims to increase reserves to 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025.
- CEO Simon Gerovich announced the appointment on March 21 via X.
- Eric Trump will aid in expanding bitcoin holdings and is involved in other cryptocurrency initiatives with his brothers.
- Following the news, Metaplanet's stock rose 1.3% to US$27.80 during trading in Japan.

items.title: Taiwan’s export orders surge 31% in Feb, driven by AI demand
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s export orders rose by 31% year-on-year in February, totaling US$49.45 billion.
- Key drivers included strong demand for AI and high-performance computing chips, and new smartphone launches.
- The figure surpassed estimates of US$43.5 billion to US$45.5 billion.
- March projections suggest a 10.3% to 14.5% growth, potentially reaching US$52 billion to US$54 billion.
- First-quarter export orders expected to increase by 11.3% to 12.8%, totaling US$148.4 billion to US$150.4 billion.
- Non-technology sectors struggled with price competition; base metals orders fell by 10.7%.

items.title: Apple supplier Wingtech sells $635m assets after US sanction
Indian B2B travel tech firm investors to sell 3.1% stake
Zomato rebrands to Eternal Limited
US VC firm Insight Partners to gain $2.7b in Alphabet-Wiz deal
UAE fintech firm NymCard secures $33m series B
Foxconn to make Mitsubishi EVs in Taiwan
Vertex Ventures Japan announces first fund closing at $66.8m
items.summary:
- Vertex Ventures Japan announced the first closing of its inaugural fund, Vertex Ventures Japan Fund I (VVJFI), with a target of 10 billion yen (US$66.8 million).
- The fund is backed by Vertex Holdings, a subsidiary of Temasek Holdings, and focuses on helping Japanese startups expand globally in sectors like deep tech, AI, digital transformation, and the creator economy.
- VVJ will utilize the Vertex global platform to connect Japanese startups with innovation hubs across Southeast Asia, India, the US, Israel, and China.
- Naonori Kurokawa has been appointed as general partner and Akiko Kihara as venture partner to lead the fund, alongside managing partner Takashi Tomita and investment committee chairmen Chua Kee Lock and Chua Taik Him.

items.title: Fintech startup Uala nets $66m series E, valued at $2.75b
items.summary:
- Uala secured US$66 million in a second close of its Series E round, totaling US$366 million.
- The funding values Uala at US$2.75 billion and includes investments from TelevisaUnivision, supporting expansion in Mexico.
- Uala aims to enhance payment, credit, and investment services in Argentina and considers regional growth and potential acquisitions.
- The first close of the Series E round was led by Allianz X, with investors including Stone Ridge Holdings, Pershing Square Foundation, and Alan Howard.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s biotech startups?
items.summary:
- The article focuses on investors active in Southeast Asia's biotech scene.
- It presents a list of investors who have backed biotech startups in the past two years.
- Only firms that invested in three or more companies in the region during this timeframe are featured.

items.title: Lyft to launch driverless rides by 2025
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lyft has announced plans to launch driverless rides by 2025.
- The initiative aims to enhance the efficiency of their ride-hailing services.
- This move is expected to significantly impact the ride-sharing industry.

items.title: LG’s IT arm partners with AI firm for agentic AI research
items.summary:
- LG CNS has partnered with Weights & Biases to advance agentic AI initiatives.
- The MOU was signed on Mar. 19 in Silicon Valley.
- The collaboration aims at sharing agentic AI technologies and improving AI services.
- Both companies will explore business opportunities in South Korea’s agentic AI market.
- Agentic AI refers to systems capable of making autonomous decisions independently.

items.title: Bureau of Indian Standards raids Amazon, Flipkart warehouses
items.summary:
- Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) conducted raids on warehouses of e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart.
- The raids were part of an investigation into the selling of non-standard products.
- This action signals increasing government scrutiny over e-commerce platforms in India.
- BIS aims to enforce compliance with Indian quality standards more rigorously.

items.title: Google’s acquisition of Wiz boosts Israel’s tax revenue
items.summary:
- Google acquires cloud security startup Wiz.
- The acquisition is expected to significantly increase Israel's tax revenue.
- The deal highlights the growing importance of tech startups in the Israeli economy.

items.title: Apple TV Plus posts $1b loss despite gaining subscribers in 2024
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus lost over US$1 billion in 2024 while gaining 45 million subscribers.
- It is the only unprofitable service among Apple’s offerings.
- Apple has reduced its content budget for Apple TV Plus by $500 million from $5 billion.
- Despite successful titles like 'Severance', Apple TV Plus captures less than 1% of streaming viewership, compared to Netflix’s 8.2%.

items.title: Boeing, Indian defense firm to co-develop autonomous vessels
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based Sagar Defence Engineering is collaborating with Boeing subsidiary Liquid Robotics.
- The partnership focuses on co-developing autonomous surface vessels in India for naval operations including data collection, surveillance, and tactical missions.
- Key areas of focus include manufacturing, system interoperability, ocean testing, and maintenance for Liquid Robotics’ Wave Glider platform.
- The initiative aims to enhance undersea domain awareness and establish maintenance infrastructure in the Indo-Pacific region.

items.title: Ola Electric raided over violations, 60 scooters seized
items.summary:
- Ola Electric faced raids by regional transport officials in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra.
- 60 electric scooters were seized during the raids due to alleged operation without necessary trade certificates.
- The Ministry of Heavy Industries is investigating reported discrepancies in sales figures; Ola Electric claimed 25,000 sales, but only 8,600 were recorded.

items.title: Hyundai to invest $12.6b in US EV plant
items.author: Jose Munoz
items.summary:
- Hyundai to invest $12.6 billion in a new factory in Georgia for Ioniq 5 and Ioniq 9 electric vehicles.
- The investment includes two battery joint ventures with SK On Co. and LG Energy Solution Ltd.
- CEO Jose Munoz emphasized the importance of a localization strategy to address potential US policy shifts under President Trump.

items.title: Meta’s Threads app lets users set default feed
items.summary:
- Meta updates Threads to allow users to set the "Following" feed or custom feeds as their default view.
- The default setting remains even after the app is closed and reopened.
- New tools for managing post interactions include limiting replies and quote-posts to followers only.
- Meta is testing a feature to let users add up to 10 topics to their bios for interests or communities.

items.title: Indian aquaculture firm Aquaconnect launches $4.5m R&D facility
items.summary:
- Aquaconnect has launched a new R&D facility with an investment of $4.5 million.
- The facility aims to enhance innovation in aquaculture practices.
- This move is part of Aquaconnect's efforts to improve productivity and sustainability in the industry.

items.title: Tesla protests expand, target showrooms worldwide
items.summary:
- Large-scale demonstrations are planned on Mar. 29, 2025, including 500 protests at Tesla showrooms globally.
- Protests started in February due to CEO Elon Musk's government layoffs and cuts to federal aid.
- Organizers stress that protests will be peaceful and advise on legal rights.
- Recent news includes Tesla receiving key approvals for robotaxi service and launching affordable Model Y in China by 2026.

items.title: Scorpio Electric cuts staff amid e-bike delivery woes
items.summary:
- Scorpio Electric, a Singapore-based e-motorcycle manufacturer, has conducted layoffs amid delivery challenges.
- The company aims to streamline operations while preparing for the launch of its first e-bike, the X1, later this year.
- Launch delays pushed back the X1's delivery from the second half of 2023 to late 2024.
- Scorpio Electric's financial situation is precarious, showing minimal revenue of US$1,080 and a loss of S$3.3 million (US$2.4 million) in FYE 2023.

items.title: Micron’s AI chips fuel $8.8b Q3 forecast on record demand
items.summary:
• Micron forecasts $8.8 billion in revenue for Q3 due to record demand for AI chips.
• The demand surge is attributed to increased investments in AI technologies.
• The forecast indicates significant growth as the company capitalizes on AI trends.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp to invest $71m in Indian EV maker Euler Motors
Nvidia to open quantum lab in Boston with MIT, Harvard
Mapping India’s cleantech key players
Indian venture capital firm All In Capital to back 50 startups
Gmail introduces AI tool to enhance email search
Apple names new Siri chief
items.summary:
- Apple is replacing John Giannandrea as the leader of its AI and Siri teams.
- The transition comes after delays in the rollout of generative AI upgrades for Siri, now pushed to 2025.
- Mike Rockwell, former leader of Apple's Vision Pro development, is set to succeed Giannandrea.
- Paule Meade, previously managing hardware engineering for Vision Pro, will lead the Vision Pro Group.

items.title: Accenture raises revenue outlook on strong AI, cloud demand
items.summary:
- Accenture revises annual revenue forecast, raising growth expectation to 5%-7%.  
- Increased forecast attributed to demand for cloud migration, AI-driven digital transformation, and data security.  
- Secured large-scale projects and partnerships in banking, telecommunications, and sports sectors.

items.title: Unicommerce acquires Shipway shipping platform
items.summary:
- Unicommerce has acquired Shipway, a shipping platform to enhance its services.
- This acquisition aims to streamline logistics and shipping for e-commerce businesses.
- Unicommerce is looking to strengthen operations in the logistics sector through this deal.

items.title: Microsoft to launch first cloud region in Malaysia
items.summary:
- Microsoft plans to open its first cloud region, Malaysia West, by mid-2025.
- The region will have three data centers in the greater Kuala Lumpur area.
- Operations are expected to begin in the second quarter of 2025.
- This follows a US$2.2 billion investment in May 2024 for expanding cloud and AI services in Malaysia over four years.

items.title: IndiaAI, Gates Foundation to boost AI in healthcare, agriculture
items.summary:
- The IndiaAI Mission and Gates Foundation are partnering to enhance AI solutions in agriculture, healthcare, education, and climate resilience.
- Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced a memorandum of understanding (MoU) after meeting Bill Gates.
- The initiative includes the IndiaAI Compute Portal for affordable AI computing resources.

items.title: Perplexity in talks to double valuation to $18b
items.summary:
- Perplexity AI is seeking funding at a US$18 billion valuation, doubling from US$9 billion.  
- The company is exploring a funding round between US$500 million and US$1 billion.  
- Nvidia backs Perplexity AI, which has been making notable recent developments.

items.title: Russian internet firm VK reports $1.13b loss
items.summary:
- VK reported a net loss of 94.9 billion roubles (US$1.13 billion) for 2024.
- This loss nearly triples the previous year's loss of 34.3 billion roubles (US$405.7 million).
- The increase was attributed to higher spending on content creation and investments in technical equipment, development, and staffing.
- Financial results were disclosed on Mar. 20, 2025, with an exchange rate of 84 roubles to the US dollar.

items.title: Weekly funding: Israel-based Kela raises $28m
items.summary:
- Israel-based startup Kela has raised $28 million in funding.
- The article presents a weekly overview of startup funding activities in Asia.
- Full details of the funding deals can be accessed via a subscription service.

items.title: China to issue first overseas yuan green bonds
items.summary:
- China’s Ministry of Finance will issue yuan-denominated green bonds in London, its first issuance outside of China.
- The bonds are valued at up to 6 billion yuan (US$829.75 million) and will fund environmentally sustainable projects.
- This initiative follows commitments from the UK-China Economic and Financial Dialogue in January, focusing on advancing sovereign green financing frameworks.
- Experts suggest this could attract international investors and enhance the yuan’s global role, aligning with China's sustainability goals and addressing Europe’s need for green financial products.

items.title: These funds have not invested in India in the past year
items.summary:
- Some funds have not invested in India for over a year despite having previously backed companies in the country.
- Potential reasons include waiting for better investment conditions or shifting focus away from the region.
- Timely outreach to investors is essential for funding opportunities.

items.title: PDD Holdings misses revenue estimates, shares drop 3%
items.summary:
- PDD Holdings' revenue for Q4 2024 was 110.61 billion yuan (US$15.27 billion), below the expected 115.38 billion yuan (US$15.92 billion).
- Following the earnings report, shares fell over 3% in premarket trading.
- Despite the revenue shortfall, net income increased to 27.45 billion yuan (US$3.79 billion), up from 23.28 billion yuan (US$3.21 billion) year-over-year.
- The company is facing challenges in its Chinese ecommerce segment due to weak consumer demand and increased competition.

items.title: Swiggy enters B2B space with new platform for kitchen supplies
items.summary:
- Swiggy has launched ‘Assure,’ a B2B platform for restaurants, hotels, and caterers to source kitchen supplies.
- The platform offers locally sourced fresh ingredients like vegetables, fruits, dairy, and canned goods via its Assure and Resto Assure apps.
- Deliveries are managed by Scootsy Logistics, a subsidiary of Swiggy, and the platform competes with Zomato’s Hyperpure.

items.title: DLocal, Temu expand payments in Africa, Asia, Latin America
items.summary:
- dLocal partners with Temu to enhance payment options in 14 emerging markets across Africa, Asia, and Latin America.
- The collaboration aims to address limited payment options and high unbanked populations that hinder global ecommerce access.
- Temu will provide localized payment solutions in countries like Mexico, Colombia, and Uruguay.
- dLocal’s infrastructure aims to reduce cart abandonment rates, which can exceed 70% in these regions.

items.title: Nvidia to invest billions in US over four years
items.summary:
- Nvidia announces a multi-billion dollar investment plan in the US over the next four years.
- Focus on expanding AI research and development capabilities.
- The investment is expected to create thousands of jobs in the technology sector.
- This move aligns with the US government's efforts to bolster domestic semiconductor manufacturing and technology innovation.

items.title: 8 unexpected yet practical insights for community building
items.summary:
- Growth does not guarantee a healthy community; engagement quality is more important than membership numbers.
- Introducing monetization can strengthen communities by improving networking quality and fostering commitment.
- Consistency in event scheduling leads to greater stability and growth for community involvement.
- Familiarity may risk complacency within community dynamics.
- Selective exclusion can be more beneficial than radical inclusion for community effectiveness.
- Community activities can contribute positively to business outcomes.
- Processes can enhance authenticity within communities.
- Delegation is essential for effective community management.

items.title: TSMC to issue $582m green bonds for eco-friendly investments
items.summary:
- TSMC to issue 19.2 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$582 million) in green bonds on Mar. 28, announced by Taipei Exchange (TPEx).
- Proceeds will fund green architecture, renewable energy projects, and related investments.
- The sale includes 12 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$363.51 million) in five-year bonds at a 1.9% coupon and 7.2 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$218.11 million) in 10-year bonds at 2.05%.
- Yuanta Securities is the primary underwriter.
- Since 2020, TSMC has raised a total of 121.9 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$3.69 billion) through green bonds, becoming Taiwan’s largest issuer.
- This issuance is part of a larger corporate bond plan of 60 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$1.82 billion) approved in November 2024 for production expansion and pollution reduction.
- Taiwan’s total outstanding green bonds now reach 627.7 billion New Taiwan Dollars (US$19.01 billion) since the first issuance in 2017.

items.title: SEA funding round sizes over the past 5 years
Shein’s US playbook needs a new look
items.summary:
- Shein faces challenges in the US as a tax exemption allowing duty-free imports for goods valued under $800 is likely to be removed.
- This change may significantly impact Shein by imposing tariffs on imports, which could erode its competitive pricing model.
- Unlike Shein, Temu's semi-consignment model may shield it from the potential impact of the tax change.
- Shein is exploring options such as investing in nearshore production to adapt its business model in response to the obstacles it faces.

items.title: Huawei’s HarmonyOS to power new computer launching in May
items.author: Richard Yu Chengdong
items.summary:
- Huawei plans to expand its HarmonyOS product lineup beyond smartphones, confirmed at the Huawei Pura launch event.
- A HarmonyOS-powered computer is set to launch in May, marking a significant step in strengthening its ecosystem.
- All Huawei devices have transitioned to the HarmonyOS ecosystem, solidifying Huawei's competitive positioning in the market.
